channel.title: FLF - Campus Preacher
channel.description: FIGHT LAUGH FEAST PRESENTS SHOWS PROCLAIMING THE LORDSHIP OF CHRIST OVER ALL OF LIFE.
channel.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: 4 Decades of Campus Preaching: Tom Short [Campus Preacher]
item.description: For the last 4 decades Tom Short has faithfully preached the Gospel on college campuses. I sat down with Tom to discuss the last 40 years of ministry.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Campus Preacher Jed Smock with Tom Short, part 2 [Campus Preacher]
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Campus Preacher Brother Jed with Tom Short [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
This is part 1 of 2 on the life of Campus Preacher Jed Smock. 

Note: I have no outro in this episode, so it ends abruptly, but we will pick it up next week.
item.author: Keith Darrell
item.itunes:author: Keith Darrell

item.title: Porn is Hate [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Porn is ubiquitous in our culture. In this podcast, I have a couple discussions I have from campus on pornography.

item.title: Is Islam & Christianity Mutually Exclusive [Campus Preacher]
item.author: Keith Darrell

item.title: Francis Schaeffer & Pre-Evangelism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Francis Schaeffer introduced me to the idea of pre-evangelism, which is an attempt to find a point of contact and tension in your neighbors non-Christian philosophy and then seeking to apply the Gospel to their life. This is a dialogue I had with a young woman on a campus, which is my attempt at some pre-evangelism.
item.author: Keith Darrell
item.itunes:author: Keith Darrell

item.title: Andy Stanley and Beth Allison Barr [Campus Preacher]
item.description: A brief interaction with an Andy Stanley tweet and some thoughts on Beth Allison Barr on the "household codes" and the Christian house.
item.author: Keith Darrell
item.itunes:author: Keith Darrell

item.title: Beth Allison Barr and The Breaking of Biblical Personhood [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Beth Allison Barr's "The Making of Biblical Womanhood" is one of the latest attacks on creation and redemption. This work attempts to be an "insider" critique, an ex-complementarian that has seen the light of egalitarianism, but it is a sub-biblical anthropology, theology, and history.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 79 Persecution Under Pluralism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Tacitus said that Christians were identified as “haters of the human race.” There is nothing new under the pluralist sun and Christians are still identified as “haters of humanity,” which is still the pretext of their marginalization/persecution in a pluralist State.
item.author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP Ep 78 Rush Limbaugh, RIP, & His Influence [Campus Preacher]
item.description: I first heard Rush Limbaugh in the early ’90’s, then in the summer of ’92, I read his book “The Way Things Ought to Be,” which had a profound influence on my thinking, and was a means the Lord used to bring me to the Gospel. This is a small tribute or thank you to Rush, acknowledging the places he influenced me.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 77 Matthew’s False Prophetic Fulfillment [Campus Preacher]
item.description: I just wanted to use alliteration. Building from Ep. 76 on Isaiah 7 and Matthew’s use of “fulfillment” and the virgin birth, I wanted to further show how this hermeneutic applies to Matthew 2 and Hosea 11.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 76 Virgin Births & Tyrants [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Matthew’s Gospel introduces Jesus via virgin birth, appealing to Isaiah 7, but, it is argued, that Isaiah 7 is not a predictive prophecy of an event 700 years into the future, but deals with the birth of a child during the life of King Ahaz. How doe we understand this?
item.author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP Ep. 75 QAnon & Inaugural Idolatry [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Whether you are on the Right or the Left, I think it’s fairly plain that chaos abounds in the United States. The root issue is worship. In this episode, I seek to address our political idolatry and the way the forward.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 73 What is Reason? Cosmic Skeptic vs Reason, Part 2 [Campus Preacher]
item.description: What is reason? Reason is often thrown out in discussions, but it is often used differently by different people. In order to properly grasp the “argument from reason” for God’s existence, we need to properly understand reason.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: What is reason? Reason is often thrown out in discussions, but it is often used differently by different people. In order to properly grasp the “argument from reason” for God’s existence, we need to properly understand reason.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 72 Cosmic Skeptic (Naturalism) vs Reason [Campus Preacher]
item.description: At the beginning of this year, I first heard about the Cosmic Skeptic and watched a debate he had about “The Argument from Reason” as a proof for God. I don’t believe his naturalist/atheist position is tenable and I seek to explain why over a couple episodes. In this episodes, I discuss the metaphysical distinctions b/t naturalism and theism.

item.description: Debrief the FLF Conference and being asked on campus if I think men own women? My answer is “yes!” Well, husbands own their wives…

item.description: The charge of “Racist! Sexist! Anti-Gay!” is often lobbed at Christians. How should we understand and interact with this?

item.title: KDCP Ep. 68 “Racist. Sexist. Anti-Gay.” [Campus Preacher]
item.description: If you’re a Christian, you’ve probably been accused of being “racist,” “sexist,” and “anti-gay.” The early Church was accused of being cannibals, incestuous, and atheists. Rhetorical bullying is nothing new. How did we get here and where do we go? In this episode, and in the next two, Aaron Ventura of Christian Reformed Fellowship and I discuss just that.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 67 Creation & Evangelism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Much evangelism begins with “sin” and “hell” and preach the Gospel as a means for the forgiveness of sin and salvation from Hell. This is often separated from the doctrine of creation and why God created the heavens and earth. Yet, man was made to have dominion over the whole earth and the through Adam’s rebellion that dominion was compromised. The Gospel, through the Second Adam, restores man to the Dominion Mandate.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 34 BLM: J.D. Greear vs Sam Harris [Campus Preacher]
item.description: J.D. Greear, the President of the SBC, gave a state of the union type address last week, discussing several key issues in the SBC along with Black Lives Matter. I think he misses the mark. Ironically, atheist Sam Harris hits a bullseye on what we need to do to move forward in the discussion.

item.title: KDCP EP. 63 Egalitarianism or Holiness of God [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
I was asked, if you were leading the Reformed Churches during this time, what would you do? I think spending a few weeks preaching the holiness of God is in order. We have almost completely lost the idea of God’s holiness, even mentioning it makes people think of hellfire preaching. While a fruit of God’s holiness is that the wicked cannot stand in the congregation of the righteous, it is rooted in the beauty of God’s character and draws worship from the Saints.

Also, I briefly discuss dispensationalism and Eph. 3:6.

item.title: KDCP Ep 62 BLM, Commies, & Commitment [Campus Preacher]
item.description: The riots and protests the past week has been classic American “revivalism,” people demonstrating great emotion, repenting, and taking up a new religious cause. In this ep, responding to a friends question about what I would do if I was in charge of the Reformed Church in given us a direction in our current crisis. In this episode, I discuss the call to commitment, take up your cross. BLM & the Communists call people to great religious devoting and Christians are often afraid to issue such a call.

item.title: KDCP Ep 61 Revolution & Conspiracy [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Revolution and Conspiracy Theories are in the air. In this ep, I take a brief look at the religious nature of the protest, appealing to Eugene Peterson’s thoughts on crowds, and give a quick intro to the idea of conspiracy theories and the Christian.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 60 Bart Ehrman vs Jesus’ Resurrection, Part II [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In “How Jesus Became God” Bart Ehrman argues that the historian cannot determine if Jesus rose from the dead, but the historian can affirm that the disciples did in fact have “visions” of Jesus post crucifixion. Seek to show the internal incoherence of Ehrman’s view.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: In “How Jesus Became God” Bart Ehrman argues that the historian cannot determine if Jesus rose from the dead, but the historian can affirm that the disciples did in fact have “visions” of Jesus post crucifixion. Seek to show the internal incoherence of Ehrman’s view.

item.title: KDCP EP 58 Bart Ehrman vs Jesus’ Burial, II [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Bart Ehrman in “How Jesus Became God” argues that there is little historical probability to the Gospel’s account of Jesus’ burial and, obviously, his resurrection. In this episode, we look at Bart’s claim that the Roman’s would’ve left Jesus on the cross, that burial was in a mass grave, and that Pilate, being a bad hombre, wouldn’t have allowed Jesus to be buried. NOTE: He’s wrong on all accounts.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP Ep 57 Bart Ehrman vs Jesus’ Burial [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Dr Bart Ehrman argues in his book “How Jesus Became God” that the New Testament accounts of the burial of Jesus are internally and externally inconsistent with what the Gospels say, as well as what we know about the Roman Empire. In this episode, I look at Bart’s claims regarding internal incoherence of the Bible’s account of the burial of Jesus.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 56 Bart Ehrman vs History [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Dr Bart Ehrman is a popular author and professor from UNC-Chapel Hill. He’s a one time Evangelical turned agnostic and Bible critic. He’s superb with rhetoric and making forceful arguments, but much of that is, despite his contention, based on secular and enlightenment presuppositions. This is part 1 of a 3 part series looking at Bart’s historiography, then I will move on to the burial and resurrection of Jesus.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 55 Bertrand Russell vs Jesus [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In his piece “Why I am Not a Christian,” Bertrand Russell suggests he’s not a Christian because of “the curious story” of Jesus and the fig tree, as well as the fact that Russell thinks Jesus predicted his “second coming” in the lifetime of his disciples. Russell doesn’t read the Bible very well, because if he understood the story of the fig, he would see it is related to Jesus “second coming” (Note: It’s not about the second coming!).

item.description: Bart Ehrman recently wrote a blog post title “A Revelatory Moment About God.” Over the next couple of episodes, we will look at his revelatory moment, its implications, and how he is helpful in framing evangelistic and apologetic discussions.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 47 Rush Limbaugh & Franklin Graham Cancelled [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Rush Limbaugh was diagnosed with late state lung cancer, so I speak briefly about how, of all people, he’s one of the people the Lord used to bring me to the Gospel via “The Way Things Ought to Be.” Also, Franklin Graham is cancelled in the UK, so what does that mean?

The idea that many have no interest in God or “spiritual things” shouldn’t surprise us, as it is the nature of man. Also, a brief dialogue with a young woman about whether or not my preaching is judgmental, at least a little.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 39 Sowing & Reaping [Campus Preacher]
item.description: There are different parts of the body and, obviously, the different parts serve different functions. The Church and its members are the Body of Christ, so each person serves their particular function – one sows, one waters, but God gives the increase. In my evangelism, I regularly see that I am one part of what God is doing on campus through me and the different groups on campus. In short, we need each other in our evangelism.

item.title: KDCP EP 38 Effectiveness & Ali’s Humility [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Is open-air preaching effective? What’s your definition of effective? Also, a discussion with Ali – a Muslim turned agnostic turned Mormon. He was very humble and seeking the truth, so I was trying to encourage him to continue to seek the Truth, Jesus of Nazareth.

item.title: KDCP EP 37 “Go Home” & Women Evangelists [Campus Preacher]
item.description: John MacArthur told Beth Moore to “go home” with respect to women preachers, but what about women open-air preachers and women in evangelism? In this episode, I briefly look at the central role of women in evangelism and an interaction with two Christian men on women preachers in the Church.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: John MacArthur told Beth Moore to “go home” with respect to women preachers, but what about women open-air preachers and women in evangelism? In this episode, I briefly look at the central role of women in evangelism and an interaction with two Christian men on women preachers in the Church.

item.title: KDCP Ep 36 #JesusIsKing & God’s Enemies [Campus Preacher]
item.description: #JesusIsKing is Kanye’s new album. He’s right – Jesus is King! And, as the King, he has enemies. We discuss both in this episode and how the King comes to wash and die for his enemies.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: #JesusIsKing is Kanye’s new album. He’s right – Jesus is King! And, as the King, he has enemies. We discuss both in this episode and how the King comes to wash and die for his enemies.

item.title: KDCP Ep 35 Postmillennialism & God’s Hate/Love [Campus Preacher]
item.description: I get asked about being a postmillennialist and we discuss the reality that the Bible teaches that God hates. What does this strange doctrine mean? I seek to brush on that in the context of open-air preaching where students accused me of “hate speech” and preaching that God “hates.” Well, I believe God hates. I don’t believe all “hate” is equal and we need to understand what the Bible means that God hates and that He loves.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 34 #MeToo, David, & Virgin’s Marrying Rapists [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Did David rape Bathsheba? I address some tweets/texts suggesting he did, and I seek to develop a paradigm for answering an objection to the Bible that “virgin’s must marry their rapist per Deut. 22:28-29.”
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP Ep. 33 Getting Started, Jesus & the Jews [Campus Preacher]
item.description: One of the most common questions I get is, how do you get started? I briefly discuss that here. Also, I am asked almost daily, “WHAT ABOUT THE JEWS?” Which is framed to suggest that any suggestion the Jews are not saved is some how anti-semitic…Here’s an interaction with a young man from campus after he asked, “I’m Jewish, am I going to Hell?” As always, I want to thank the All Saved Freak Band for allowing to use “Sower” in the intro and outro.

item.title: KDCP EP 32 Gospel Conversations: Christian Supremacy [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Here are two conversations from campus that are centered on the idea of “Christian Supremacy.” The basic idea is that something is going to be supreme in a culture and, since Jesus is the Truth, I maintain that Jesus and his supremacy ought to be maintained by the Christian. In the mind of many, the concept of “supremacy” means oppression, but it is the Most High God that comes and serves, washing the feet of his enemies.

item.title: KDCP EP 31: Drew Brees, Wisdom, & Campus Converstations [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Drew Brees took some heat from encouraging kids to bring their Bibles to school, then he took heat from some in the Church, and I think we need more wisdom on these types of issues. Also, I play two clips from campus. One discussion is with a humble agnostic kid and the other with a Christian seeking clarification.

item.title: KDCP Ep. 30 – Evangelism & Thought-Terminating Cliches [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Robert Jay Lifton has an outstanding book called “Thought Reform and the Psychology of Totalism: A Study of ‘Brainwashing’ in China.” In chapter 22, he lays out 8 phenomena of “Ideological Totalism” and he discusses “thought-terminating cliches.” This is an important concept that is helpful in our evangelism, because we realize that people are given cliches to prevent them from thinking further and deeper about issues. Once we recognize these cliches, we have the opportunity to deal with this terminating language and press certain issues further.
item.author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP – EP. 29 Peter Atherton’s Confusion [Campus Preacher]
item.description: A couple weeks ago, there was a glitch in the matrix, so Ep. 29 & 30 did not properly upload. This week I’m blessed with something close to laryngitis, so it works well for me. In this episode, I finish my interaction with Peter Atherton’s NYTimes opinion piece “The God Problem,” which isn’t really a problem, but a problem with poor definitions.

item.title: KDCP – EP 30 Back to the Basics [Campus Preacher]
item.description: As the Church faces increasing social marginalization, we need to return to the basics of the church and evangelism.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: As the Church faces increasing social marginalization, we need to return to the basics of the church and evangelism.

item.title: KDCP – Ep. 28: Dayton Shooting & Sin [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Central to our evangelism is addressing the nature and reality of sin. Often sin is dealt with in a trivial – everyone knows they’re a sinner – so we rarely address the depths of the nature of the sin of man in our evangelism and relying on “human flourishing” or mere psychological categories. A recovery of the reality of sin is what our soul sick culture needs.

item.title: KDCP: Ep 27- Joshua Harris, Apostasy, & Keepin’ Yo Kids [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Joshua Harris, an influential “purity culture” advocate and pastor, has renounced the Faith. We look at his apostasy and seek to relate it to the most common question I get in the Church, “How do you keep your kids in the Faith?”
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP Ep 26 #PurityCulture & Good Creation [Campus Preacher]
item.description: We brush on Joshua Harris’ divorce and #PurityCulture, as well as continue our response to Dr Peter Atterton’s “A God Problem.”
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: We brush on Joshua Harris’ divorce and #PurityCulture, as well as continue our response to Dr Peter Atterton’s “A God Problem.”

item.title: KDCP-Ep. 25 Omnipotence Paradox [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
Over the next few weeks, I’ll look at God’s attributes of omnipotence, omnibenevolence, and omniscience, and whether or not they present a problem for the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. This week I focus on omnipotence.

Intro and outro music: All Saved Freak Band “The Sower.”
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

This week I focus on omnipotence. Intro and outro music: All Saved Freak Band “The Sower.”

item.title: KDCP-Ep. 24: Is Theism Coherent? [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In March, the NY Times published an opinion piece arguing that theism, understood as “God” being an “omnipotent,” “omniscient,” and “omnibenevolent” being is incoherent. I introduce that issue, which we will address over the next few weeks each one of these attributes and seek to show they are actually coherent.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:summary: In March, the NY Times published an opinion piece arguing that theism, understood as “God” being an “omnipotent,” “omniscient,” and “omnibenevolent” being is incoherent. I introduce that issue, which we will address over the next few weeks each one of these attributes and seek to show they are actually coherent.

item.title: KDCP: Ep. 23: Why Pluralism? Norm Geisler, RIP [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Norm Geisler passed today, so I speak about his influence on me early on in my Christian life, and then I address “why pluralism?” or, really, why so many different religions? At the Tower of Babel God divided the Nations and handed them over to the “sons of God,” but kept Israel for himself.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

At the Tower of Babel God divided the Nations and handed them over to the “sons of God,” but kept Israel for himself.

item.title: KDCP: Ep. 22: Pluralism is Exclusivism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In this episode, we look at the claims of pluralism, both religious and political, that suggest the exclusivist religious claims are arrogant intellectually and morally. We show that pluralism is open to the same charges they make against exclusivism and is in fact an “exclusivistic” point of view. The ASFB leads us in and out with “The Sower.”
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP – Ep. 22: Persecution and Pluralism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: The early Church was birthed in the Roman Empire, a pluralist society that persecuted the early church. The American Empire has some parallels to the Roman Empire, including pluralism, and it is willing to tolerate all forms of worship, as long as they fall in line with the American Empire. This week, building out of Francis Schaeffer, we look at why the early church was persecuted and how that squares with current pluralist notions. Thanks to The All Saved Freak Band for allowing me to use “Sower” for my intro and outro.

item.title: KDCP-Ep. 21 Old Cross & New, Pluralism [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Pluralism is a central element of our society and any evangelism is going to have to deal with pluralist objections, both intellectual and psychological. We introduce the issue this week as well as look at A.W. Tozer’s “The Old Cross and the New”

item.title: KDCP-EP 20 Copycat Religion [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Ever so brief look at Horus and Mithra re: Christianity copying their religious dogmas. We also touch on revival and prayer in the expansion of the Kingdom.

item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP – Ep. 19 Jesus is a Myth [Campus Preacher]
item.description: This episode I round out the historicity of Jesus and touch on the idea that the Pauline Epistles are actually “mythological” in nature and not rooted in a real, historical Jesus. As always, the All Saved Freak Band’s “Sower” brings us in and out.

item.title: KDCP – Ep. 18: Abortion & the Resurrection [Campus Preacher]
item.description: Abortion is front and center in the news, so I explain how I discuss the topic on campus. And I round out the fact of arguing for the historical resurrection of Jesus of Nazareth by 1 Cor 15:1-9 and Gal. 1 & 2. Also, as always, I’d like to thank the AllSavedFreakBand.com for allowing me to use their music for my intro and outro.

item.title: KDCP – Ep 16: The Crux [Campus Preacher]
item.description: We look at eradicating materialist presuppositions in the believer, briefly look at the practical aspect of engaging an unbeliever with the Bible or utilizing other resources in *persuading* the unbeliever, and then give a brief account on why we believe the crucifixion with a real, historical event.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP: Ep. 15 – Jesus Didn’t Exist [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In this episode, I address the “Christ Myth,” the idea that Jesus of Nazareth didn’t really exist, but is the invention of the early Church. We look at the internal evidence from the Bible, as well the work of Tacitus and Josephus. In short, yes, he existed.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: KDCP – Ep. 14: The Resurrection [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In this episode, I begin to lay out the historical case for Jesus’ resurrection. I lay out why you should believe the Gospels were written within 40 years of the death of Jesus by eyewitnesses or secondhand accounts. The intro and outro music is provided by the All Saved Freak Band. You can visit my website at CampusPreacher.com, if you have any questions for me.

item.title: KDCP: Episode 12-The Jewish Question, Part 4 [Campus Preacher]
item.description: This episode we wrap up our brief outline on doing apologetics to Jews and we cover Daniel 7 and Mark 13. Mark 13 is about the destruction of Jerusalem and not the “second coming.” Also and as always, I want to thank the All Saved Freak Band for allowing me to use their song “Sower” for my intro and outro.

item.title: KDCP: The Jewish Question, Part 3 [Campus Preacher]
item.description: This is part 3 of our 4 part series on “The Jewish Question.” Basically, why do we believe that Jesus is the Jewish Messiah? In this episode, we take a brief look at Daniel 9 and how it tells us the timing of the Messiah.

item.title: KDCP: The Jewish Question, Part 2 [Campus Preacher]
item.description: This is part 2 of our, now, 4 part series on evangelizing/apologetics with our Jewish friends. In this episode, I look at Daniel 2 and the the prophetic timing of the coming of the Kingdom, which is during the Roman Empire. And what happened? The Kingdom came just like Daniel said it would. Thanks to the All Saved Freak Band for allowing me to use their music for my introduction.

item.title: KDCP: The Jewish Question, Part 1 [Campus Preacher]
item.description: A common claim is that Christianity, Judaism, and Islam are the Abrahamic Faiths. There’s some truth to this, but Christians need to show that the Abrahamic Faith points to Jesus and not to modern Judaism or Islam.

item.title: KDCP: Gospel is Hate Speech [Campus Preacher]
item.description: The preaching of the Gospel will be met with intellectual and emotional objections. Most of the emotional objections include the assertion that the one evangelizing is intolerant, judgmental, and hates, so how do address that issue?

item.title: Campus Preacher: Episode 4: Fraidy Cat Christianity and the New Hegemony [Campus Preacher]
item.description: In Episode 4 of the Campus Preacher Podcast, I look at the Barna Groups’ discovery that 44% of Christians “would avoid discussions about my faith if my non-Christian friend would reject me.” We show that the New Testament addresses this fear with the hope of the Gospel and that Christians are beginning to internalize the world’s narrative.. If you have any questions, please contact me on twitter @CampusEvangel or via email @ Keith@ CampusPreacher.com

item.title: Campus Preacher: Episode 3 – Gospel, Hellfire & Brimstone, & Rulers Be Warned [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
This is episode 3 of the Campus Preacher Podcast. We finish our introductory discussion on the Gospel and Hellfire and Brimstone preaching, as well as give a brief look at Psalm 2 and its import for evangelism and speaking to the rulers and governors.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact me Keith@CampusPreacher.com and visit CampusPreacher.com

item.title: Campus Preacher – Episode 2: The Gospel & Hellfire & Brimstone Preaching [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
In this Episode of the Campus Preacher, I address the shade I threw at John MacArthur’s hell Gospel, give a brief historical background for the term Gospel, and seek to answer the question, “Who Made God?”

Please visit www.campuspreacher.com and reach out via twitter @CampusEvangel

item.title: Campus Preacher: Episode 1 – Introduction [Campus Preacher]
item.description:
Welcome to the Campus Preacher Podcast. In Episode 1 the Campus Preacher, Keith Darrell, is introduced and the trajectory of the podcast set – encourage and equip Christians in the work of evangelism. We will seek to do this in three ways: Discussions on Evangelism, Apologetics, and Rhetoric.

If a Christian is to bring the Gospel into the Public Square (evangelize), he needs to be prepared to defend the Gospel (apologetics) and to speak to our cultural context (rhetoric). Welcome to the Campus Preacher Podcast.
